quest.name: Labors of My Fruit
journal:
 Quest Sync
This creator recognizes you...or does he?
objectives: Deliver the nameless red fruit to the observers.

dialogue.name: ELEGANCECREATOR04285
dialogue.text:
Azem? What in the blazes are you doing here?
Hold on─ You seem...thinner somehow.

dialogue.name: ELEGANCECREATOR04285
dialogue.text: Hmm... You have much in common with herhim but it's clear you're not one of us. A familiar perhaps?

dialogue.name: ELEGANCECREATOR04285
dialogue.text: I suppose it's just like herhim to send one of herhis minions to poke its nose into our affairs. But since you're here, instead of hanging around like a bad smell, why don't you make yourself useful?

dialogue.name: ELEGANCECREATOR04285
dialogue.text: I want you to take this latest work of mine─a new variety of fruit─to my colleagues.

dialogue.name: ELEGANCECREATOR04285
dialogue.text: In the meantime, I will be cultivating more specimens in the Cthonic Horns. Yes, you heard that correctly. Cultivating, not simply conjuring with creation magicks. Aye, the fruit I produce is a labor of love.

dialogue.name: ELEGANCECREATOR04285
dialogue.text: Now that my newest masterpiece is close to completion, I would have my fellow researchers sample its delights. I wish to hear their impressions before I make the final adjustments.

dialogue.name: ELEGANCECREATOR04285
dialogue.text: Unfortunately, for all their wisdom, I find them intolerable at the best of times, never mind when they are critiquing my work. For that reason, I would have you go in my stead. And be quick about it─lest the fruit spoil as a result of your dawdling.

dialogue.name: ELEGANCECREATOR04285
dialogue.text: Yes? Is something the matter? I've already given you your instructions, and I'd prefer not to repeat myself. Now go.

dialogue.name: OBSERVERA04285
dialogue.text: You are the familiar who arrived with Emet-Selch and Hythlodaeus, yes? And what do we have here?

dialogue.name: OBSERVERA04285
dialogue.text: A new species of fruit, eh? Let us hope it tastes better than it looks.

dialogue.name: OBSERVERA04285
dialogue.text: My word!

dialogue.name: OBSERVERA04285
dialogue.text: What an unusual flavor! Equal parts bitter, musty, and tart...and not entirely unpleasant. I am curious to know how such a thing was created.

dialogue.name: OBSERVERA04285
dialogue.text: Grown from seed in the Cthonic Horns, you say? In my experience, leaving such things to nature leads to wildly varying results. To have bred such a specimen must've been incredibly time-consuming, not to mention inefficient.

dialogue.name: OBSERVERB04285
dialogue.text: You wish to speak with me?

dialogue.name: OBSERVERB04285
dialogue.text: My impressions? Very well.

dialogue.name: OBSERVERB04285
dialogue.text: Good gracious, what...is this!?

dialogue.name: OBSERVERB04285
dialogue.text: It's so outrageously bitter, something akin to a wave of icy cold has spread throughout my entire body!

dialogue.name: OBSERVERB04285
dialogue.text: I certainly wouldn't eat this out of choice, but it could be made into medicine for staving off the heat in arid environments.

dialogue.name: OBSERVERC04285
dialogue.text: Are you lost, little familiar?

dialogue.name: OBSERVERC04285
dialogue.text: For me? Why yes, I should love to try a piece!

dialogue.name: OBSERVERC04285
dialogue.text: Hmm...

dialogue.name: OBSERVERC04285
dialogue.text: I don't mean to be rude, but this falls somewhere between “rather foul” and “positively revolting.” It's so bitter, it's practically inedible.

dialogue.name: OBSERVERC04285
dialogue.text: More important, however, is the question of whether this fruit would serve its intended function. If wild animals cannot bring themselves to eat it, the seeds will never be spread. I can't imagine this creation being approved in its current state.

dialogue.name: ELEGANCECREATOR04285
dialogue.text: You are returned, minus three fruit samples, I presume?

dialogue.name: ELEGANCECREATOR04285
dialogue.text: Is that so? Not one of them found it to their liking? They claimed my last attempt was too sweet, and now it's too bitter!? Honestly, the nerve of these so-called experts!

dialogue.name: ELEGANCECREATOR04285
dialogue.text: As they shall soon learn, I am not so easily deterred.

dialogue.name: ELEGANCECREATOR04285
dialogue.text: For my next creation, I'll cross-pollinate sour and sweet varieties, and see what they have to say about that!

dialogue.name: ELEGANCECREATOR04285
dialogue.text: I'll show them it's these “wildly varying results” that come from adherence to natural processes that have the power to defy expectations! And as the familiar of Azem herselfhimself, I'm sure you can appreciate that!
